Formats.title: Tournament Formats
Formats.subtitle: Choose the best format for your tournament

groupPlayoff.name: Groups + Playoff
groupPlayoff.desc: Teams are divided into groups where everyone plays against each other. The top teams from each group advance to a single-elimination playoff bracket.
groupPlayoff.howItWorks:
1. Teams are randomly split into groups of 3-4
2. Each group plays round-robin (everyone vs everyone)
3. Top 2 from each group advance to playoffs
4. Playoffs are single-elimination until the champion
groupPlayoff.bestFor: 8-32 teams. Guarantees each team plays several matches before elimination begins.
groupPlayoff.example: 16 teams → 4 groups of 4 → 8 advance → Quarterfinals → Semifinals → Final

roundRobin.name: Round Robin
roundRobin.desc: Every team plays against every other team. The team with the most points at the end wins. No elimination — everyone plays the same number of matches.
roundRobin.howItWorks:
1. Schedule is generated so every team meets every other team once
2. Win = 3 points, Draw = 1 point, Loss = 0 points
3. Final standings determine the champion
roundRobin.bestFor: 4-10 teams. Fairest format — every team faces every opponent.
roundRobin.example: 6 teams → 15 matches total → 5 rounds → Winner by points

singleElimination.name: Single Elimination
singleElimination.desc: Lose once and you're out! The fastest tournament format — each match eliminates one team until only the champion remains.
singleElimination.howItWorks:
1. Teams are paired up in an elimination bracket
2. Winners advance, losers are eliminated
3. Each round halves the field until the final
singleElimination.bestFor: 4-64 teams. Quick format when time is limited.
singleElimination.example: 8 teams → Quarterfinals (4 matches) → Semifinals (2) → Final (1) = 7 matches total

groupReclass.name: Groups + Reclassification
groupReclass.desc: Teams play in initial groups, then get regrouped by placement. All 1st-place teams play each other for the championship, all 2nd-place teams for 5th-8th, and so on.
groupReclass.howItWorks:
1. Teams split into groups of 3-4, play round-robin
2. After all group matches, teams are regrouped by placement:
   - All 1st-place teams → Gold Group (play for 1st-4th)
   - All 2nd-place teams → Silver Group (play for 5th-8th)
   - All 3rd-place teams → Bronze Group (play for 9th-12th)
   - All 4th-place teams → Consolation Group (play for 13th-16th)
3. Each reclassification group plays round-robin
4. Final standings within each group determine overall placement
groupReclass.bestFor: 12-20 teams. Every team plays many matches and gets ranked precisely.
groupReclass.example: 16 teams → 4 groups of 4 → Regroup → Gold/Silver/Bronze/Consolation → Final rankings 1st-16th

About.title: About tur2tur
About.intro: tur2tur is the all-in-one tournament management platform. We help organizers everywhere create, manage, and share sports tournaments with ease.
About.missionDesc: To make tournament organizing effortless — so coaches, clubs, and communities can focus on the game, not the paperwork.
About.whoDesc: We're a small team of sports enthusiasts and developers who got tired of managing tournaments with spreadsheets and messaging apps.
About.regionDesc: Available in multiple languages with support for Lithuanian, Latvian, Estonian, and English. Works for any sport, any format.
About.contactDesc: Questions, partnerships, or feedback? Reach us at
About.whyDesc: We believe every tournament — from a local kids' football cup to a national championship — deserves proper tools. No more paper brackets, no more WhatsApp score updates, no more manual standings calculations. tur2tur handles it all.
About.value1: Simple by default — powerful when you need it
About.value2: Fair pricing — generous free tier, affordable upgrades
About.value3: Built for organizers — designed for real sports culture
About.value4: Transparent — your data, your tournaments, your rules

Privacy.title: Privacy Policy

Privacy.collectItem2: Tournament data: tournament names, team names, player names, match scores, and schedules you create
Privacy.collectItem3: Payment information: processed securely through Stripe — we never store your card details
Privacy.collectItem4: Usage data: pages visited, features used, and device information for improving the service
Privacy.useDesc: We use the collected information to:
Privacy.useItem1: Provide, maintain, and improve the tur2tur platform
Privacy.useItem2: Process payments and manage your subscription
Privacy.useItem3: Send important service updates (we don't send marketing emails without consent)
Privacy.sharingDesc: We do not sell your personal information. Tournament data you mark as public is visible to other users. We share data only with: Supabase (database hosting), Stripe (payment processing), and Vercel (website hosting). All providers comply with GDPR.
Privacy.cookiesDesc: We use essential cookies for authentication and session management. We do not use tracking or advertising cookies. Analytics are privacy-friendly and anonymized.
Privacy.rightsDesc: As a user in the EU/EEA, you have the right to: access your personal data, correct inaccurate data, delete your data (right to be forgotten), export your data, and object to processing. To exercise any of these rights, contact us.
Privacy.contactDesc: For privacy-related questions, contact us at
